title: After 19 Years Of Hard Work, Maharashtra Pilot Made An Experimental Airplane On His Terrace
text:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi, on Sunday, met Amol Yadav - a pilot from Maharashtra, who made an airplane on his own and that too from scratch. He made a six-seater indigenous experimental aircraft, after he was given Rs 35,000 crore deal for India’s first plane factory last year. He also said that Prime Minister assured him of his support for this project.

Yadav said that he was happy to know that PM Narendra Modi was following the project and keeping up with it. "I am really happy that he was following the project and invited me to his house. He asked me if my dream has been fulfilled now. It was unexpected for me. He knows a lot about my project," Yadav told news agency ANI.

ANI

"He asked me several questions about the project and assured me of support. I have been working on this aircraft for 19 years," he added.

To everyone’s surprise, he made the experimental aircraft on the terrace of his home in over a period of 19 years. With such big responsibilities also come great difficulties, and that was true for him too.
